poem:
"An Ode to the Spring Triangle"

The spring triangle, drawn
in the night o' deep sapphire,
marking seasons in speckled skylines.
Three bright heralds dance
at the height of searchlights,
Charting the course of fruits to ripen.
Gems of Orion huddled,
on nature's cosmic canvas,
Graphing heaven, our ephemeral spring.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Starwatch: look out for the colours of the Spring Triangle Today we’ll look at a pattern of stars, a grouping known as an asterism, that heralds the season of spring. In the northern hemisphere, this asterism is known as the Spring Triangle, but for those in the southern hemisphere, Autumn Triangle would be more appropriate. It is formed by three bright stars in three constellations that are prominent at this time of year. The stars". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
